intro: Lithocardium abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high altitudes. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, adding ornamental value. Lithocardium abyssinicum is valued both for its resilience and its aesthetic appeal in horticulture.
